<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><a name="item13"></a><B>ITEM
13. CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE.</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white; color: red"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
June 15, 2018, the Company entered into a promissory note payable with David Lazar, the former Chief Executive Officer. The note is unsecured,
noninterest bearing and due in 12 months from the date of issuance. On December 13, 2018, the Company forgave $5,000 of the entire amount
owed on this promissory note to David Lazar. The gain was recorded in additional paid in capital due to its related party nature. As
of June 30, 2020 and 2019, $0 remains outstanding.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
June 19, 2018, the Company issued 3,096,200 shares of common stock issued at par value of $0.001, for services valued at $3,096 to Custodian
Ventures, LLC, the company controlled by David Lazar.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
June 19, 2018 the Company created 10,000,000 shares of Series A Preferred Stock, out of the 10,000,000 shares that were already authorized.
On that same date, the Company issued 10,000,000 shares of the Series A preferred stock to Custodian Ventures LLC, the company controlled
by David Lazar, the former Chief Executive Officer, for services valued at $4,000,000.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
December 16, 2018, Custodian Ventures LLC (the &ldquo;Seller&rdquo;), entered into a Stock Purchase Agreement (the &ldquo;Stock Purchase
Agreement&rdquo;) pursuant to which the Seller agreed to sell to Xingtao Zhou and Yaqin Fu (together, the &ldquo;Purchaser&rdquo;), the
3,096,200 common shares and the 10,000,000 preferred shares of the Company (together, the &ldquo;Shares&rdquo;) owned by the Seller,
for a total purchase price of $375,000. As a result of the sale, and David Lazar&rsquo;s resignation as sole officer and director of
the Company, there was a change of control of the Company. There is no family relationship or other relationship between the Seller and
the Purchaser.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->19<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page --><P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">During
the period July 01, 2018 thru December 13, 2018, David Lazar, paid $17,350 of expenses related to accounting, transfer agent, audit and
legal fees on behalf of the company. On December 13, 2018, the Company forgave $31,446 of the loan payable to David Lazar. The gain was


recorded in additional paid in capital due to its related party nature. As of June 30, 2021 and 2020, $0 remains outstanding.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">During
the years ended June 30, 2021 and 2020, Mr. Xingtao Zhou, paid a total of $33,748 and $79,189 respectively, in expenses on behalf of
the Company, for transfer agent, legal, audit and accounting fees. As of June 30, 2021 and 2020, The outstanding balances owed to Mr.
Zhou are $128,793, and $95,045 respectively. This loan is non-interest bearing and has no specific terms for repayment.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; background-color: white"><B>Conflicts
of Interest</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; background-color: white">Certain
potential conflicts of interest are inherent in the relationships between our officers and directors, and the Company.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; background-color: white">From
time to time, one or more of our affiliates may form or hold an ownership interest in and/or manage other businesses both related and
unrelated to the type of business that we own and operate. These persons expect to continue to form, hold an ownership interest in and/or
manage additional other businesses which may compete with ours with respect to operations, including financing and marketing, management
time and services and potential customers. These activities may give rise to conflicts between or among the interests of us and other
businesses with which our affiliates are associated. Our affiliates are in no way prohibited from undertaking such activities, and neither
we nor our shareholders will have any right to require participation in such other activities.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; background-color: white">Further,
because we intend to transact business with some of our officers, directors and affiliates, as well as with firms in which some of our
officers, directors or affiliates have a material interest, potential conflicts may arise between the respective interests of us and
these related persons or entities. We believe that such transactions will be completed on terms at least as favorable to us as those
available from unrelated third parties.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><a name="item14"></a><B>ITEM
14. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTING FEES AND SERVICES.</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
following table shows the fees paid or accrued by us for the audit and other services provided by <FONT STYLE="background-color: white">WWC,
P.C., (&ldquo;WWC&rdquo;) for the periods ended June 30, 2021 and JLKZ CPA LLP for the periods ended June 30, 2020.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; color: red"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>June 30,</B></FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>June 30,</B></FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>2021</B></FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap; padding-bottom: 1.5pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 1.5pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>2020</B></FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap; padding-bottom: 1.5pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC">
    <TD STYLE="width: 78%"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Audit Fees</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">$</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 8%; border-top: black 1pt solid; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">240,000</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap; width: 1%"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">$</FONT></TD>

    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap; width: 1%"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Audit Related Fees</FONT></TD>

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">240,000</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap; border-bottom: white 2.25pt double; padding-bottom: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="padding-bottom: 3pt; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

    <TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">60,000</FONT></TD>
    <TD STYLE="white-space: nowrap; border-bottom: white 2.25pt double; padding-bottom: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
  </TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Audit
fees consist of fees billed for professional services rendered for the audit of our financial statements and review of the interim financial
statements included in quarterly reports and services that are normally provided by the above auditors in connection with statutory and
regulatory fillings or engagements.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Audit-Related
Fees&quot; are fees for assurance and related services by the principal accountant that are traditionally performed by the principal
accountant and which are &quot;reasonably related to the performance of the&nbsp;audit or review of the registrant's financial statements.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">In
the absence of a formal audit committee, the full Board of Directors pre-approves all audit and non-audit services to be performed by
the independent registered public accounting firm in accordance with the rules and regulations promulgated under the Securities Exchange
Act of 1934, as amended. The Board of Directors pre-approved 100% of the audit, audit-related and tax services performed by the independent
registered public accounting firm for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2021 and 2020. The percentage of hours expended on the principal
accountant&rsquo;s engagement to audit the Company&rsquo;s financial statements for the most recent fiscal year that were attributed
to work performed by persons other than the principal accountant&rsquo;s full-time, permanent employees was 0%.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->21<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><B>SIGNATURES</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Pursuant
to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by
the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->22<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>

    <P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 11pt/10pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 5pt; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><IMG SRC="image_002.jpg" ALT="" STYLE="height: 111px; width: 629px"></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">REPORT</FONT> OF INDEPENDENT
REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">To:&#9;The Board <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of</FONT>
Directors <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and </FONT>Stockholders of</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in">Cang <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Bao</FONT> Tian
Xia International Art Trade Center Inc.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9.5pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Opinion</FONT>
on the Financial Statements</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">We</FONT>
have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Cang <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Bao</FONT> Tian Xia International
Art Trade Center Inc. <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and</FONT> its subsidiaries (the Company) as <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of</FONT>
June 30, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">2021</FONT> and 2020, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and</FONT> the related consolidated
statements <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of</FONT> operations and <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">comprehensive loss,</FONT>
changes in shareholders&#8217; equity, and <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">cash</FONT> flows <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">for</FONT>
the two-year period ended June 30, 2021, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and</FONT> the related notes (collectively <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">referred</FONT>
to as the financial statements). In our opinion, the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">financial</FONT> statements present fairly,
in all material <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">respects, the financial</FONT> position of the Company as <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of</FONT>
June 30, 2021 <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and 2020,</FONT> and the results of its <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">operations</FONT>
and its <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">cash</FONT> flows for the two-year <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">period</FONT> ended
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">June</FONT> 30, 2021, in <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">conformity</FONT> with accounting
principles <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">generally</FONT> accepted in the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: 0.05pt">United</FONT> <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">States</FONT>
of America.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9.5pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The accompanying financial statements have <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">been</FONT>
prepared assuming that the Company will continue as a <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">going</FONT> concern. As <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">discussed</FONT>
in Note 3 to the financial statements, the Company had <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">incurred substantial losses</FONT> during
the year, and has a working capital deficit, which raises substantial doubt about its ability to continue as a going concern. Management&#8217;s
plan in regards to these matters are described in Note 3. These financial statements do not include <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">any</FONT>
adjustments that might result <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">from</FONT> the outcome of this <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">uncertainty.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 9.5pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Basis</FONT>
for <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Opinion</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">These financial statements are the responsibility
of <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">the</FONT> Company&#8217;s management. <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Our responsibility</FONT>
is to express an opinion <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">on</FONT> the Company&#8217;s <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">financial</FONT>
statements based on <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">our audits. We</FONT> are a public <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">accounting
</FONT>firm <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: 0.05pt">registered</FONT> with the Public Company Accounting Oversight <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Board</FONT>
(United <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">States) (PCAOB)</FONT> and are <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">required</FONT> to
be independent <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">with</FONT> respect to the Company <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.1pt">in</FONT>
accordance with the U.S. federal <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">securities</FONT> laws and the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">applicable</FONT>
rules <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and</FONT> regulations of the Securities and Exchange <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Commission</FONT>
and the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">PCAOB.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">We</FONT>
conducted our audits in accordance with the standards <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of</FONT> the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">PCAOB.</FONT>
Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">financial</FONT>
statements are <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">free of material</FONT> misstatement, whether due to error <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">or
</FONT>fraud. The Company <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.1pt">is </FONT>not required to have, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">nor
were </FONT>we engaged to perform, an audit <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of</FONT> its <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">internal</FONT>
control over financial reporting. As <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">part</FONT> of <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">our</FONT>
audits, we are <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">required</FONT> to obtain an understanding of internal control <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">over
financial</FONT> reporting, but <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">not</FONT> for the purpose of <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">expressing</FONT>
an opinion on <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">the</FONT> effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">control</FONT>
over <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">financial</FONT> reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our audits <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">included
performing procedures</FONT> to <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">assess</FONT> the risks of material misstatement of the financial
statements, whether due to error or <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">fraud,</FONT> and <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">performing
procedures</FONT> that respond to those <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">risks.</FONT> Such procedures included examining, on a test
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">basis,</FONT> evidence <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">regarding</FONT> the amounts <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: 0.05pt">and</FONT>
disclosures in the financial statements. Our audits also included evaluating <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">the</FONT> accounting
principles used <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and significant estimates</FONT> made by management, as well as evaluating the overall
presentation of the financial <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">statements. We</FONT> believe that our <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: 0.05pt">audits
</FONT>provide a <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">reasonable</FONT> basis for <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">our opinion.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"><IMG SRC="image_003.jpg" ALT="" STYLE="height: 48px; width: 624px"></P>

<P STYLE="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><BR STYLE="clear: both"></P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><A NAME="report"></A><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->F-1<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page --><P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>



<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Critical <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">Audit</FONT>
Matters</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9.5pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The critical audit matter <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">communicated</FONT>
below <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">is</FONT> matter <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">arising from</FONT> the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">prior</FONT>
period audit of the consolidated <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">financial</FONT> statements that were communicated or required
to be communicated to <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">the</FONT> audit <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">committee</FONT> and
that: <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">(1)</FONT> relate <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.1pt">to</FONT> accounts or disclosures that
are material to the consolidated financial statements and (2) involved <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">our</FONT> especially challenging,
subjective, or complex <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">judgments. The communication</FONT> of critical audit matters does not alter
in <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">any way</FONT> our opinion <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">on</FONT> the consolidated financial
statements, taken <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">as</FONT> a whole, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and</FONT> we <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">are
not,</FONT> by communicating the critical audit matters below, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">providing</FONT> separate opinions
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">on</FONT> the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">critical</FONT> audit matters or on the accounts
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">or</FONT> <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: 0.05pt">disclosures</FONT> <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.1pt">to</FONT>
which they relate.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Evaluation of the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">accounts</FONT>
receivable and the allowance for <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">doubtful</FONT> accounts</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><B>&nbsp;</B></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The critical audit matter related to the Company&#8217;s
accounts receivable. The <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">principal</FONT> considerations in determining that this was a critical
audit matter was that the Company had a <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">substantial</FONT> amount of accounts receivable, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and</FONT>
the allowance for doubtful <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">accounts</FONT> are subject to estimation, which involves judgment. <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">The</FONT>
ability of <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">the</FONT> Company <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.1pt">to</FONT> collect the accounts
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">receivable</FONT> is impacted by multiple <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">factors.</FONT>
The audit engagement <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">team</FONT> addressed this critical accounting matter by reviewing the Company&#8217;s
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">accounting</FONT> policies, <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and perform</FONT> extended procedures
<FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">including</FONT> corroborated with enquiry, examination <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">of
contracts,</FONT> and independent analysis of <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">the Company customers</FONT> historical payment records.
The engagement team&#8217;s <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">testing</FONT> provided adequate evidence to <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">support</FONT>
our audit <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">opinion</FONT> and to mitigate the <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">risk</FONT> of
material misstatement to an acceptable level. <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">The</FONT> accounts that are affected by <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">this</FONT>
critical audit matter is accounts receivable, and the allowance <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">for doubtful</FONT> accounts that
is <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">charged</FONT> to general <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">and administration</FONT> expenses,
if <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">any.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">/s/ WWC, P.C.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">WWC, P.C.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Certified Public Accountants</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">We</FONT> have served as the
Company&#8217;s auditor <FONT STYLE="letter-spacing: -0.05pt">since</FONT> 2021 San Mateo, California</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">October 13, 2021</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

    <TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right">363,199</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right">(129,261</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: left">)</TD></TR>
  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="text-indent: -9pt; padding-left: 27pt">Prepayments</TD><TD>&nbsp;</TD>

Accompanying Notes to the Financial Statements</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->F-6<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

    <P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt; background-color: white"><a name="notes"></a><B>CANG
BAO TIAN XIA INTERNATIONAL ART TRADE CENTER, INC.</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>NOTES
TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>JUNE
30, 2021 AND 2020</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>NOTE
1 &ndash; ORGANIZATION AND BASIS OF ACCOUNTING</B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Cang
Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center, Inc., formerly Zhongchai Machinery, Inc., and before that Equicap, Inc., a Nevada corporation
(the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;, was a manufacturer and distributor of gears and gearboxes and drive axles that were marketed and sold to
equipment manufacturers in China.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
July 6, 2007, the Board of Directors of Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Zhejiang Zhongchai&rdquo;), the China based and
75% owned subsidiary of the Company, approved and finalized a Share Purchase Agreement (&ldquo;Share Purchase Agreement&rdquo;) with
Xinchang Keyi Machinery Co., Ltd., (&ldquo;Keyi&rdquo;) a corporation incorporated in the People&rsquo;s Republic of China. Pursuant
to the Share Purchase Agreement, Zhejiang Zhongchai purchased all the outstanding equity of Zhejiang Shengte Transmission Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Shengte&rdquo;)
from Keyi, the sole owner of Shengte for approximately $3.7 million</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
March 7, 2007, the Company and Usunco Automotive, Ltd. (&ldquo;Usunco&rdquo;), a British Virgin Islands company, entered into a Share
Exchange Agreement (&ldquo;Exchange Agreement&rdquo;) which was consummated on March 9, 2007. Under the terms of the Exchange Agreement,
the Company acquired all of the outstanding equity securities of Usunco in exchange for 18,323,944 shares of the Company&rsquo;s common
stock.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Since
the Company had been a public shell company prior to the share exchange, the share exchange was treated as a recapitalization of the
Company. As such, the historical financial information prior to the share exchange was that of Usunco and its subsidiaries. Historical
share amounts were restated to reflect the effect of the share exchange.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
June 18, 2006, Usunco acquired 100% of IBC Automotive Products Inc (&ldquo;IBC&rdquo;), a California Corporation as of May 14, 2004 (date
of inception), through a Share Exchange Agreement of 28% of Usunco&rsquo;s shares. IBC was considered a &ldquo;predecessor&rdquo; business
to Usunco as its operations constituted the business activities of Usunco formed to consummate the acquisition of IBC. The consolidated
financial statements at that time reflected all predecessor statements of income and cash flow activities from the inception of IBC in
May 2004.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
June 15, 2009, IBC was sold to certain management persons of IBC in exchange for the following: (i) the cancellation of an aggregate
of 555,994 shares of common stock of the Company which those individuals owned, and (ii) the payment of $60,000 in installments pursuant
to the terms of an unsecured promissory note, the final payment of which was made on November 15, 2010. As part of the transaction, the
Company cancelled $428,261 through the closing date, of inter-company debt which funds had been used in the business of IBC prior to
the transaction.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
September 22, 2009, Xinchang Xian Lisheng Machinery Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Lisheng&rdquo;) was incorporated by Zhejiang Zhongchai and two
individual investors. Total registered capital of Lisheng was RMB 5 million, of which Zhejiang Zhongchai accounted for 60%. The Company
started production of die casting products in 2010 for use in gearboxes, diesel engines and other machinery products.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
December 16, 2009, Zhongchai Machinery and its wholly owned subsidiaries, Usunco and Zhongchai Holding (Hong Kong) Limited, a Hong Kong
company (&ldquo;Zhongchai Holding&rdquo;), took action to approve transfer of the shares of Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., from Usunco
to Zhongchai Holding. The transfer was completed on December 23, 2009. The purpose of the transfer was to take advantage of the tax treaty
between the Peoples Republic of China and the Special Administrative Region of Hong Kong which reduces the withholding tax rate of the
PRC on payments to entities outside of China. Usunco, which no longer had any assets after transferring all of them to Zhongchai Holding
was subsequently dissolved. The consolidated financial statements continued to account for Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., in the same
manner as before the transfer of the ownership. Shareholder approval by the shareholders of Zhongchai Machinery was not required under
Nevada law, as there was no sale of all or substantially all the assets of the Company. The shareholder ownership and shareholder rights
of Zhongchai Machinery remained the same as before the transaction.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->F-7<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

    <P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
April 26, 2010, Zhongchai Holding (Hong Kong) Limited (&ldquo;Zhongchai Holding&rdquo;), which owned 75% of the equity in Zhejiang Zhongchai
Machinery Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Zhejiang Zhongchai&rdquo;), executed a Share Purchase Agreement (&ldquo;Share Purchase Agreement&rdquo;)
with Xinchang Keyi Machinery Co., Ltd., (&ldquo;Keyi&rdquo;) a corporation incorporated in the People&rsquo;s Republic of China. Pursuant
to the Share Purchase Agreement, Zhongchai Holding purchased the residual 25% equity of Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Zhejiang
Zhongchai&rdquo;) from Keyi at $2.6 million. The Share Purchase Agreement was approved by the local government agency and a new business
license was issued as Wholly Foreign Owned Enterprise.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
July 26, 2011, the Company held a Special Meeting of Shareholders. At the special meeting the Company&rsquo;s shareholders approved an
amendment to cease its periodic reporting obligation under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and thereby forego many of the expenses
associates with operating as a public company subject to SEC reporting obligations.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
July 27, 2011, the Company approved a 1 for 120 reverse stock split of its then outstanding shares of the Company&rsquo;s Common Stock.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
July 29, 2011, the Company terminated its registration as a reporting issuer with the Securities and Exchange Commission. As a result,
it became unclear when and if the Company ceased conducting business operations, as no further information became publicly available.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
May 11, 2018, the eighth judicial District Court of Nevada appointed Custodian Ventures, LLC as custodian for the Company, then known
as Zhongchai Machinery, Inc., proper notice having been given to the officers and directors of Zhongchai Machinery, Inc. There was no
opposition. On May 16, 2018, the Company filed a certificate of revival with the State of Nevada, appointing David Lazar as, President,
Secretary, Treasurer and Director. On June 19, 2018, the Company issued 3,096,200 shares of common stock issued at par value of $0.001,
to Custodian Ventures, LLC, for services valued at $3,096.20. On June 19, 2018, the Company issued 10,000,000 shares of Series A Preferred
Stock issued at par value of $0.001, to Custodian Ventures, LLC, for services valued at $4,000,000.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
July 24, 2018, the Company filed a Form 10 with the Securities and Exchange Commission, to again become a reporting issuer.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
December 16, 2018, Custodian Ventures LLC (the &ldquo;Seller&rdquo;), entered into a Stock Purchase Agreement (the &ldquo;Stock Purchase
Agreement&rdquo;) pursuant to which the Seller agreed to sell to Xingtao Zhou and Yaqin Fu (together, the &ldquo;Purchaser&rdquo;), the
3,096,200 common shares and the 10,000,000 preferred shares of the Company (together, the &ldquo;Shares&rdquo;) owned by the Seller,
for a total purchase price of $375,000. As a result of the sale, and David Lazar&rsquo;s resignation as sole officer and director of
the Company, there was a change of control of the Company. There is no family relationship or other relationship between the Seller and
the Purchaser.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
January 08, 2019, the corporate name of the Company was changed to Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center, Inc., and shortly
thereafter the Company&rsquo;s trading symbol was changed to TXCB.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
July 27, 2020 (the &ldquo;Closing Date&rdquo;), and as reported in the Company&rsquo;s Form 8-K filed with the SEC on that same date,
we entered into a Share Exchange Agreement (the &ldquo;Exchange Agreement&rdquo;) by and among (i) the Company, (ii) Zhi Yuan Limited,
a Cayman Islands company (&ldquo;Cayman Company&rdquo;), and (iii) the three beneficial shareholders of Cayman Company (each, a &ldquo;Cayman
Company Shareholder&rdquo; and collectively, the &ldquo;Cayman Company Shareholders&rdquo;).</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Pursuant
to the terms of the Exchange Agreement, the Cayman Company Shareholders agreed to sell to Cang Bao, and Cang Bao agreed to purchase,
all shares of Cayman Company held by them, which shares represent 100% of the issued and outstanding shares of Cayman Company. In exchange,
Cang Bao agreed to issue to the Cayman Company Shareholders an aggregate of 75,000,000 shares of Cang Bao common stock, representing
approximately 67.98% of Cang Bao&rsquo;s total issued and outstanding common stock (the &ldquo;Share Exchange&rdquo;).</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Our
directors approved the Exchange Agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby. Simultaneously, the directors of Cayman Company
also approved the Exchange Agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby. The Share Exchange closed on July 27, 2020. Both Yaqin
Fu, who is the wife of one of our directors, and Mr. Xingtao Zhou, our President, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chairman
of the Board and principal shareholder, were Cayman Company Shareholders who exchanged their Cayman Company shares for shares of the
Company. After giving effect to the Share Exchange, Mr. Zhou owns 59,839,271 shares of our common stock, which represents 54.24% of our
outstanding common stock, and 100% of our issued and outstanding preferred shares.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->F-8<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page --><P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">As
a result of the Share Exchange, Cayman Company became our wholly owned subsidiary and we are its public holding company. After giving
effect to the Share Exchange, the Company acquired 100% of the assets and operations of Cayman Company and its subsidiaries, the business
and operations of which now constitutes our primary business and operations. After giving effect to the Share Exchange, we own 100% of
the issued and outstanding shares of capital stock of Cayman Company. Cayman Company is a holding company that owns Cangyun (Hong Kong)
Limited (&ldquo;Hong Kong Company&rdquo;), which in turn owns and controls Shanghai Cangyun Management Consulting Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Management
Consulting&rdquo;), which has entered into contractual agreements to control Hainan Cangbao Tianxia Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Hainan&rdquo;)
and Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Tianxia Cultural Relic,&rdquo; and together with Hainan, the &ldquo;Target
Companies&rdquo; or &ldquo;VIEs&rdquo;).</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
Exchange Agreement contains customary representations, warranties, covenants and conditions for a transaction of this type for the benefit
of the parties.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">For
federal income tax purposes, it is intended that the Share Exchange qualify as a reorganization under the provisions of Section 368(a)
of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &ldquo;Code&rdquo;). However, we did not obtain any tax opinion and there can be
no assurance that our intent that the Share Exchange qualify as a reorganization under the provisions of Section 368(a) of the Code is
correct. Cayman Company is considered the acquirer for accounting and financial reporting purposes. The assets and liabilities of Cayman
Company have been brought forward at their book value and no goodwill has been recognized. As a result of the acquisition of all the
issued and outstanding shares of Cayman Company, we have now assumed Cayman Company&rsquo;s business operations as our own.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Immediately
prior to the closing of the Share Exchange described above pursuant to which Cayman Company became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company,
the Company was a &ldquo;shell company,&rdquo; as such term is defined in Rule 12b-2 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended
(the &ldquo;Exchange Act&rdquo;). As a result of the Share Exchange, we are no longer a &ldquo;shell company.&rdquo;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
Share Exchange was accounted as a business combination under common control, in which all of the combining entities or businesses are
ultimately controlled by the same party or parties, both before and after the business combination, and that control is not transitory.
The business combination under common control of accounting is based on the historical consolidated financial statements of the Company
and Cayman Company. In accordance with ASC 805-50-45-5, for transactions between entities under common control, financial statements
and financial information presented for prior periods have been retroactively adjusted to furnish comparative information.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Zhi
Yuan Limited (&ldquo;Zhi Yuan&rdquo;) was incorporated on April 15, 2019 under the laws of the Cayman Islands as a holding company. On
May 22, 2019, ZhiYuan incorporated a wholly owned subsidiary Cang Yun (Hong Kong) Limited (&ldquo;Cang Yun HK&rdquo;) in Hong Kong. On
July 30, 2019, Cang Yun HK incorporated a wholly foreign owned enterprise (&ldquo;WFOE&rdquo;) Shanghai Cangyun Management Consulting
Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Shanghai Cangyun&rdquo;) in Shanghai, China.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">On
August 8, 2019, Shanghai Cangyun entered into a series of Variable Interest Entity (&ldquo;VIE&rdquo;) agreements with the owners of
Hainan Cangbao Tianxia Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&ldquo;Hainan Cangbao&rdquo;) and Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural Relic Co., Ltd.
(&ldquo;Shanghai Cangbao&rdquo;). Pursuant to the VIE agreements, Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao became Shanghai Cangyun&rsquo;s
contractually controlled affiliate. The purpose and effect of the VIE Agreements is to provide Shanghai Cangyun with all management control
and net profits earned by Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao. Hainan Cangbao was incorporated on May 30, 2018 and Shanghai Cangbao was
incorporated on June 28, 2019. The entities operate an online and offline cultural exchange service platform, through which dedicated
to create industry standards for art investment and creating a model of online art exchanges and transactions, which allows collectors,
artists, art dealers and owners to access a much larger art trading market, allowing them to engage with a wide range of collectibles
or artwork investors. Upon executing a series of VIE agreements, Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao are considered Variable Interest
entities (&ldquo;VIE&rdquo;) and Shanghai Cangbao is the primary beneficiary. Accordingly, Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao are consolidated
under the guidance of FASB Accounting Standards Codification (&ldquo;ASC&rdquo;) 810, Consolidation.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Cang
Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries and VIE are collectively referred to herein as the
&ldquo;Company&rdquo; unless specific reference is made to an entity.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font-size: 10pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left"><td style="width: 33%">&#160;</td><td style="width: 34%; text-align: center"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->F-9<!-- Field: /Sequence --></td><td style="width: 33%; text-align: right">&#160;</td></tr></table></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page --><P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B>NOTE
2 &ndash; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</B></FONT></P>



<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B><I>Basis
of Presentation</I></B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
accompanying audited consolidated financial statements have been prepared in conformity with accounting principles generally
accepted in the United States of America (&ldquo;U.S. GAAP&rdquo;). This basis of accounting differs in certain material respects from
that used for the preparation of the books of Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao, which are prepared in accordance with the accounting
principles and the relevant financial regulations applicable to enterprises with limited liabilities established in the PRC (&ldquo;PRC
GAAP&rdquo;), the accounting standards used in the places of their domicile. The accompanying audited consolidated financial
statements reflect necessary adjustments not recorded in the books of Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao to present them in conformity
with U.S. GAAP.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><B><I>Principals
of Consolidation</I></B></FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
audited consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company, its wholly and majority owned subsidiaries,
and consolidated VIE and its subsidiaries for which the Company is the primary beneficiary.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">All
transactions and balances among the Company, its subsidiaries and&nbsp;consolidated VIE have been eliminated upon consolidation.</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
accompanying audited consolidated financial statements of Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center, Inc. reflect
the activities of the following entities:</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

    <P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&#183;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Incorporated

    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

  <TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC">
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Cang Yun (Hong Kong) Limited (&ldquo;Cang Yun HK&rdquo;)</FONT></TD>

    on May 30, 2018</FONT></P>

    <P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&#183;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operate
    online and offline cultural exchange service platform</FONT></P></TD>
    <TD><FONT STYLE="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
