    <us-gaap:OtherExpenses contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">348031</us-gaap:OtherExpenses>
    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 1 &amp;#8211; ORGANIZATION AND BASIS OF ACCOUNTING&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center,&#13;Inc., formerly Zhongchai Machinery, Inc., and before that Equicap, Inc., a Nevada corporation (the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;, was a manufacturer&#13;and distributor of gears and gearboxes and drive axles that were marketed and sold to equipment manufacturers in China.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 6, 2007, the Board of Directors of Zhejiang&#13;Zhongchai Machinery Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Zhejiang Zhongchai&amp;#8221;), the China based and 75% owned subsidiary of the Company, approved and&#13;finalized a Share Purchase Agreement (&amp;#8220;Share Purchase Agreement&amp;#8221;) with Xinchang Keyi Machinery Co., Ltd., (&amp;#8220;Keyi&amp;#8221;)&#13;a corporation incorporated in the People&amp;#8217;s Republic of China. Pursuant to the Share Purchase Agreement, Zhejiang Zhongchai purchased&#13;all the outstanding equity of Zhejiang Shengte Transmission Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Shengte&amp;#8221;) from Keyi, the sole owner of Shengte for&#13;approximately $3.7 million&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On March 7, 2007, the Company and Usunco Automotive,&#13;Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Usunco&amp;#8221;), a British Virgin Islands company, entered into a Share Exchange Agreement (&amp;#8220;Exchange Agreement&amp;#8221;)&#13;which was consummated on March 9, 2007. Under the terms of the Exchange Agreement, the Company acquired all of the outstanding equity&#13;securities of Usunco in exchange for 18,323,944 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Since the Company had been a public shell company&#13;prior to the share exchange, the share exchange was treated as a recapitalization of the Company. As such, the historical financial information&#13;prior to the share exchange was that of Usunco and its subsidiaries. Historical share amounts were restated to reflect the effect of the&#13;share exchange.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 18, 2006, Usunco acquired 100% of IBC Automotive&#13;Products Inc (&amp;#8220;IBC&amp;#8221;), a California Corporation as of May 14, 2004 (date of inception), through a Share Exchange Agreement&#13;of 28% of Usunco&amp;#8217;s shares. IBC was considered a &amp;#8220;predecessor&amp;#8221; business to Usunco as its operations constituted the business&#13;activities of Usunco formed to consummate the acquisition of IBC. The consolidated financial statements at that time reflected all predecessor&#13;statements of income and cash flow activities from the inception of IBC in May 2004.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 15, 2009, IBC was sold to certain management&#13;persons of IBC in exchange for the following: (i) the cancellation of an aggregate of 555,994 shares of common stock of the Company which&#13;those individuals owned, and (ii) the payment of $60,000 in installments pursuant to the terms of an unsecured promissory note, the final&#13;payment of which was made on November 15, 2010. As part of the transaction, the Company cancelled $428,261 through the closing date, of&#13;inter-company debt which funds had been used in the business of IBC prior to the transaction.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 22, 2009, Xinchang Xian Lisheng Machinery&#13;Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Lisheng&amp;#8221;) was incorporated by Zhejiang Zhongchai and two individual investors. Total registered capital of Lisheng&#13;was RMB 5 million, of which Zhejiang Zhongchai accounted for 60%. The Company started production of die casting products in 2010 for use&#13;in gearboxes, diesel engines and other machinery products.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 16, 2009, Zhongchai Machinery and its&#13;wholly owned subsidiaries, Usunco and Zhongchai Holding (Hong Kong) Limited, a Hong Kong company (&amp;#8220;Zhongchai Holding&amp;#8221;), took&#13;action to approve transfer of the shares of Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., from Usunco to Zhongchai Holding. The transfer was completed&#13;on December 23, 2009. The purpose of the transfer was to take advantage of the tax treaty between the Peoples Republic of China and the&#13;Special Administrative Region of Hong Kong which reduces the withholding tax rate of the PRC on payments to entities outside of China.&#13;Usunco, which no longer had any assets after transferring all of them to Zhongchai Holding was subsequently dissolved. The consolidated&#13;financial statements continued to account for Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., in the same manner as before the transfer of the ownership.&#13;Shareholder approval by the shareholders of Zhongchai Machinery was not required under Nevada law, as there was no sale of all or substantially&#13;all the assets of the Company. The shareholder ownership and shareholder rights of Zhongchai Machinery remained the same as before the&#13;transaction.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On April 26, 2010, Zhongchai Holding (Hong Kong) Limited&#13;(&amp;#8220;Zhongchai Holding&amp;#8221;), which owned 75% of the equity in Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Zhejiang Zhongchai&amp;#8221;),&#13;executed a Share Purchase Agreement (&amp;#8220;Share Purchase Agreement&amp;#8221;) with Xinchang Keyi Machinery Co., Ltd., (&amp;#8220;Keyi&amp;#8221;)&#13;a corporation incorporated in the People&amp;#8217;s Republic of China. Pursuant to the Share Purchase Agreement, Zhongchai Holding purchased&#13;the residual 25% equity of Zhejiang Zhongchai Machinery Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Zhejiang Zhongchai&amp;#8221;) from Keyi at $2.6 million. The Share&#13;Purchase Agreement was approved by the local government agency and a new business license was issued as Wholly Foreign Owned Enterprise.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 26, 2011, the Company held a Special Meeting&#13;of Shareholders. At the special meeting the Company&amp;#8217;s shareholders approved an amendment to cease its periodic reporting obligation&#13;under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and thereby forego many of the expenses associates with operating as a public company subject&#13;to SEC reporting obligations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 27, 2011, the Company approved a 1 for 120&#13;reverse stock split of its then outstanding shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 29, 2011, the Company terminated its registration&#13;as a reporting issuer with the Securities and Exchange Commission. As a result, it became unclear when and if the Company ceased conducting&#13;business operations, as no further information became publicly available.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On May 11, 2018, the eighth judicial District Court&#13;of Nevada appointed Custodian Ventures, LLC as custodian for the Company, then known as Zhongchai Machinery, Inc., proper notice having&#13;been given to the officers and directors of Zhongchai Machinery, Inc. There was no opposition. On May 16, 2018, the Company filed a certificate&#13;of revival with the State of Nevada, appointing David Lazar as, President, Secretary, Treasurer and Director. On June 19, 2018, the Company&#13;issued 3,096,200 shares of common stock issued at par value of $0.001, to Custodian Ventures, LLC, for services valued at $3,096.20. On&#13;June 19, 2018, the Company issued 10,000,000 shares of Series A Preferred Stock issued at par value of $0.001, to Custodian Ventures,&#13;LLC, for services valued at $4,000,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 24, 2018, the Company filed a Form 10 with&#13;the Securities and Exchange Commission, to again become a reporting issuer.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 16, 2018, Custodian Ventures LLC (the&#13;&amp;#8220;Seller&amp;#8221;), entered into a Stock Purchase Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Stock Purchase Agreement&amp;#8221;) pursuant to which the Seller&#13;agreed to sell to Xingtao Zhou and Yaqin Fu (together, the &amp;#8220;Purchaser&amp;#8221;), the 3,096,200 common shares and the 10,000,000 preferred&#13;shares of the Company (together, the &amp;#8220;Shares&amp;#8221;) owned by the Seller, for a total purchase price of $375,000. As a result of&#13;the sale, and David Lazar&amp;#8217;s resignation as sole officer and director of the Company, there was a change of control of the Company.&#13;There is no family relationship or other relationship between the Seller and the Purchaser.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On January 08, 2019, the corporate name of the Company&#13;was changed to Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center, Inc., and shortly thereafter the Company&amp;#8217;s trading symbol was changed&#13;to TXCB.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 27, 2020 (the &amp;#8220;Closing Date&amp;#8221;),&#13;and as reported in the Company&amp;#8217;s Form 8-K filed with the SEC on that same date, we entered into a Share Exchange Agreement (the&#13;&amp;#8220;Exchange Agreement&amp;#8221;) by and among (i) the Company, (ii) Zhi Yuan Limited, a Cayman Islands company (&amp;#8220;Cayman Company&amp;#8221;),&#13;and (iii) the three beneficial shareholders of Cayman Company (each, a &amp;#8220;Cayman Company Shareholder&amp;#8221; and collectively, the&#13;&amp;#8220;Cayman Company Shareholders&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Pursuant to the terms of the Exchange Agreement, the&#13;Cayman Company Shareholders agreed to sell to Cang Bao, and Cang Bao agreed to purchase, all shares of Cayman Company held by them, which&#13;shares represent 100% of the issued and outstanding shares of Cayman Company. In exchange, Cang Bao agreed to issue to the Cayman Company&#13;Shareholders an aggregate of 75,000,000 shares of Cang Bao common stock, representing approximately 67.98% of Cang Bao&amp;#8217;s total issued&#13;and outstanding common stock (the &amp;#8220;Share Exchange&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Our directors approved the Exchange Agreement and&#13;the transactions contemplated thereby. Simultaneously, the directors of Cayman Company also approved the Exchange Agreement and the transactions&#13;contemplated thereby. The Share Exchange closed on July 27, 2020. Both Yaqin Fu, who is the wife of one of our directors, and Mr. Xingtao&#13;Zhou, our President, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Chairman of the Board and principal shareholder, were Cayman Company&#13;Shareholders who exchanged their Cayman Company shares for shares of the Company. After giving effect to the Share Exchange, Mr. Zhou&#13;owns 59,839,271 shares of our common stock, which represents 54.24% of our outstanding common stock, and 100% of our issued and outstanding&#13;preferred shares.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As a result of the Share Exchange, Cayman Company became our wholly owned subsidiary and we are its public holding company.&#13;After giving effect to the Share Exchange, the Company acquired 100% of the assets and operations of Cayman Company and its subsidiaries,&#13;the business and operations of which now constitutes our primary business and operations. After giving effect to the Share Exchange,&#13;we own 100% of the issued and outstanding shares of capital stock of Cayman Company. Cayman Company is a holding company that owns Cangyun&#13;(Hong Kong) Limited (&amp;#8220;Hong Kong Company&amp;#8221;), which in turn owns and controls Shanghai Cangyun Management Consulting Co., Ltd.&#13;(&amp;#8220;Management Consulting&amp;#8221;), which has entered into contractual agreements to control Hainan Cangbao Tianxia Cultural Relic&#13;Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Hainan&amp;#8221;) and Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Tianxia Cultural Relic,&amp;#8221; and together&#13;with Hainan, the &amp;#8220;Target Companies&amp;#8221; or &amp;#8220;VIEs&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"&gt;The Exchange Agreement contains&#13;customary representations, warranties, covenants and conditions for a transaction of this type for the benefit of the parties.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"&gt;For federal income tax purposes,&#13;it is intended that the Share Exchange qualify as a reorganization under the provisions of Section 368(a) of the Internal Revenue Code&#13;of 1986, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Code&amp;#8221;). However, we did not obtain any tax opinion and there can be no assurance that our intent&#13;that the Share Exchange qualify as a reorganization under the provisions of Section 368(a) of the Code is correct. Cayman Company is considered&#13;the acquirer for accounting and financial reporting purposes. The assets and liabilities of Cayman Company have been brought forward at&#13;their book value and no goodwill has been recognized. As a result of the acquisition of all the issued and outstanding shares of Cayman&#13;Company, we have now assumed Cayman Company&amp;#8217;s business operations as our own.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"&gt;Immediately prior to the closing&#13;of the Share Exchange described above pursuant to which Cayman Company became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, the Company was&#13;a &amp;#8220;shell company,&amp;#8221; as such term is defined in Rule 12b-2 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Exchange&#13;Act&amp;#8221;). As a result of the Share Exchange, we are no longer a &amp;#8220;shell company.&amp;#8221;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"&gt;The Share Exchange was accounted&#13;as a business combination under common control, in which all of the combining entities or businesses are ultimately controlled by the&#13;same party or parties, both before and after the business combination, and that control is not transitory. The business combination under&#13;common control of accounting is based on the historical consolidated financial statements of the Company and Cayman Company. In accordance&#13;with ASC 805-50-45-5, for transactions between entities under common control, financial statements and financial information presented&#13;for prior periods have been retroactively adjusted to furnish comparative information.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify; margin-right: 0; margin-left: 0"&gt;Zhi Yuan Limited (&amp;#8220;Zhi&#13;Yuan&amp;#8221;) was incorporated on April 15, 2019 under the laws of the Cayman Islands as a holding company. On May 22, 2019, ZhiYuan incorporated&#13;a wholly owned subsidiary Cang Yun (Hong Kong) Limited (&amp;#8220;Cang Yun HK&amp;#8221;) in Hong Kong. On July 30, 2019, Cang Yun HK incorporated&#13;a wholly foreign owned enterprise (&amp;#8220;WFOE&amp;#8221;) Shanghai Cangyun Management Consulting Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Shanghai Cangyun&amp;#8221;)&#13;in Shanghai, China.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On August 8, 2019, Shanghai Cangyun entered into a&#13;series of Variable Interest Entity (&amp;#8220;VIE&amp;#8221;) agreements with the owners of Hainan Cangbao Tianxia Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Hainan&#13;Cangbao&amp;#8221;) and Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Shanghai Cangbao&amp;#8221;). Pursuant to the VIE agreements,&#13;Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao became Shanghai Cangyun&amp;#8217;s contractually controlled affiliate. The purpose and effect of the&#13;VIE Agreements is to provide Shanghai Cangyun with all management control and net profits earned by Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao.&#13;Hainan Cangbao was incorporated on May 30, 2018 and Shanghai Cangbao was incorporated on June 28, 2019. The entities operate an online&#13;and offline cultural exchange service platform, through which dedicated to create industry standards for art investment and creating a&#13;model of online art exchanges and transactions, which allows collectors, artists, art dealers and owners to access a much larger art trading&#13;market, allowing them to engage with a wide range of collectibles or artwork investors. Upon executing a series of VIE agreements, Hainan&#13;Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao are considered Variable Interest entities (&amp;#8220;VIE&amp;#8221;) and Shanghai Cangbao is the primary beneficiary.&#13;Accordingly, Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao are consolidated under the guidance of FASB Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;ASC&amp;#8221;)&#13;810, Consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center,&#13;Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries and VIE are collectively referred to herein as the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221; unless specific reference&#13;is made to an entity.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SchedulesOfConcentrationOfRiskByRiskFactorTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The concentration on purchases from suppliers&amp;#8217; as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;12,959,643&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;     <us-gaap:ScheduleOfRelatedPartyTransactionsTableTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The related parties consisted of the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;     <TXCB:PropertyAndEquipmentUsefulLivesTableTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the estimated&#13;useful lives of the assets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 51%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Electronic equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 46%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;3-5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;     <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in conformity&#13;with U.S. GAAP requires management to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, disclosure&#13;of contingent assets and liabilities on the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during&#13;the reporting period. The Company bases its estimates and judgments on historical experience and on various other assumptions and information&#13;that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances. Estimates and assumptions of future events and their effects cannot be perceived&#13;with certainty and, accordingly, these estimates may change as new events occur, as more experience is acquired, as additional information&#13;is obtained and as our operating environment changes. Significant estimates and assumptions by management include, among others, useful&#13;lives and impairment of long-lived assets, allowance for doubtful accounts, income taxes including the valuation allowance for deferred&#13;tax assets. While the Company believes that the estimates and assumptions used in the preparation of the financial statements are appropriate,&#13;actual results could differ from those estimates. Estimates and assumptions are periodically reviewed, and the effects of revisions are&#13;reflected in the financial statements in the period they are determined to be necessary.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s long-lived assets are reviewed&#13;for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability&#13;of an asset to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of the asset to the future undiscounted cash flows&#13;expected to be generated by the asset. If such asset is considered to be impaired, the impairment to be recognized is measured by the&#13;amount by which the carrying amount of the asset exceeds its fair value. Impairment evaluations involve management&amp;#8217;s estimates on&#13;asset useful lives and future cash flows. Actual useful lives and cash flows could be different from those estimated by management which&#13;could have a material effect on our reporting results and financial position. Fair value is determined through various valuation techniques&#13;including discounted cash flow models, quoted market values and third-party independent appraisals, as considered necessary.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company adopted ASC 820 &amp;#8220;Fair Value Measurements,&amp;#8221;&#13;which defines fair value, establishes a three-level valuation hierarchy for disclosures of fair value measurement and enhances disclosures&#13;requirements for fair value measures. Current assets and current liabilities qualified as financial instruments and management believes&#13;their carrying amounts are a reasonable estimate of fair value because of the short period of time between the origination of such instruments&#13;and their expected realization and if applicable, their current interest rate is equivalent to interest rates currently available.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The three levels are defined as follow:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 5%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 93%; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;inputs to the valuation methodology are quoted prices (unadjusted) for identical assets or liabilities in active markets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;inputs to the valuation methodology include quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets, and inputs that are observable for the assets or liability, either directly or indirectly, for substantially the full term of the financial instruments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;inputs to the valuation methodology are unobservable and significant to the fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of the balance sheet date, the estimated fair values&#13;of the financial instruments approximated their fair values due to the short-term nature of these instruments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company evaluates the hierarchy disclosures each&#13;year to determine which category an asset or liability falls within the hierarchy.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:LesseeLeasesPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Leases&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We determine if an arrangement is a lease at inception.&#13;Operating leases are included in operating lease right-of-use (&amp;#8220;ROU&amp;#8221;) assets, operating lease liabilities - current, and operating&#13;lease liabilities - noncurrent on the balance sheets. Finance leases are included in property and equipment, other current liabilities,&#13;and other long-term liabilities in our balance sheets.&amp;#160;&lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;The initial lease liability is equal&#13;to the future fixed minimum lease payments discounted using the Company&amp;#8217;s incremental borrowing rate, on a secured basis. The initial&#13;measurement of the right-of-use asset is equal to the initial lease liability plus any initial direct costs and prepayments, less any&#13;lease incentives.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;ROU assets represent our right to use an underlying&#13;asset for the lease term and lease liabilities represent our obligation to make lease payments arising from the lease. Operating lease&#13;ROU assets and liabilities are recognized at commencement date based on the present value of lease payments over the lease term. As most&#13;of our leases do not provide an implicit rate, we generally use our incremental borrowing rate based on the estimated rate of interest&#13;for collateralized borrowing over a similar term of the lease payments at commencement date. The operating lease ROU asset also includes&#13;any lease payments made and excludes lease incentives. Our lease terms may include options to extend or terminate the lease when it is&#13;reasonably certain that we will exercise that option. Lease expense for lease payments is recognized on a straight-line basis over the&#13;lease term.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:LesseeLeasesPolicyTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 16 &amp;#8211; SUBSEQUENT EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company evaluates subsequent events that have&#13;occurred after the balance sheet date but before the financial statements are issued. There are two types of subsequent events: (1) recognized,&#13;or those that provide additional evidence with respect to conditions that existed at the dates of the balance sheets, including the estimates&#13;inherent in the process of preparing financial statements, and (2) non-recognized, or those that provide evidence with respect to conditions&#13;that did not exist at the date of the balance sheet but arose subsequent to that date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company evaluates subsequent events that have&#13;occurred after the balance sheet date but before the financial statements are issued. Based on this evaluation, the Company concluded&#13;that subsequent to June 30, 2021 but prior to the date the financial statements were available to be issued, and has determined that it&#13;does not have any material events to disclose.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 3 &amp;#8211; GOING CONCERN&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying audited consolidated financial statements&#13;have been prepared assuming that the Company will continue as a going concern; however, the Company has incurred a net loss of $8,445,157&#13;for the year ended June 30, 2021. As of June 30, 2021, the Company had an accumulated deficit of $33,499,423, working capital deficit&#13;of $17,113,370.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In order to continue as a going concern, the Company&#13;will need, among other things, additional capital resources. Management&amp;#8217;s plan is to obtain such resources for the Company by obtaining&#13;capital from management and significant shareholders sufficient to meet its minimal operating expenses and seeking third party equity&#13;and/or debt financing. However, management cannot provide any assurances that the Company will be successful in accomplishing any of its&#13;plans. These financial statements do not include any adjustments related to the recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts&#13;and classification of liabilities that might be necessary should the Company be unable to continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cash and cash equivalents include cash on hand and&#13;cash in time deposits, certificates of deposit and all highly liquid instruments with original maturities of three months or less.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:AdvertisingCostsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Advertising Expenses&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Advertising costs, mainly including promotion expense&#13;for the APP launching, are expensed as incurred and the total amounts charged to &amp;#8220;selling and marketing expenses&amp;#8221; in the audited&#13;consolidated statements of income and comprehensive loss were $2,845,139 and $499,954 for the year ended June 30, 2021 and 2020, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:AdvertisingCostsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;New Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In December 2019, the FASB issued ASU 2019-12 - Income&#13;Taxes (Topic 740): Simplifying the Accounting for Income Taxes. This ASU provides an exception to the general methodology for calculating&#13;income taxes in an interim period when a year-to-date loss exceeds the anticipated loss for the year. This update also (1) requires an&#13;entity to recognize a franchise tax (or similar tax) that is partially based on income as an income-based tax and account for any incremental&#13;amount incurred as a non-income-based tax, (2) requires an entity to evaluate when a step-up in the tax basis of goodwill should be considered&#13;part of the business combination in which goodwill was originally recognized for accounting purposes and when it should be considered&#13;a separate transaction, and (3) requires that an entity reflect the effect of an enacted change in tax laws or rates in the annual effective&#13;tax rate computation in the interim period that includes the enactment date. The standard is effective for the Company for fiscal years&#13;beginning after December 15, 2020, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently in the process of evaluating the impact of&#13;the adoption on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In February 2020, the FASB issued ASU 2020-02, &amp;#8220;Financial&#13;Instruments &amp;#8211; Credit Losses (Topic 326) and Leases (topic 842) Amendments to SEC Paragraphs Pursuant to SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin&#13;No. 119 and Update to SEC Section on Effective Date Related to Accounting Standards Update No. 2016-02, Leases (topic 842)&amp;#8221;. This&#13;ASU provides guidance regarding methodologies, documentation, and internal controls related to expected credit losses. This ASU is effective&#13;for interim and annual periods beginning after December 15, 2019, and early adoption is permitted. The Company is evaluating the impact&#13;of this guidance on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2018, the FASB issued ASU 2018-13, &amp;#8220;Fair&#13;Value Measurement (Topic 820), &amp;#8211; Disclosure Framework &amp;#8211; Changes to the Disclosure Requirements for Fair Value Measurement,&amp;#8221;&#13;which makes a number of changes meant to add, modify or remove certain disclosure requirements associated with the movement amongst or&#13;hierarchy associated with Level 1, Level 2 and Level 3 fair value measurements. The amendments in this Update modify the disclosure requirements&#13;on fair value measurements based on the concepts in FASB Concepts Statement, Conceptual Framework for Financial Reporting&amp;#8212;Chapter&#13;8: Notes to Financial Statements, including the consideration of costs and benefits. The amendments on changes in unrealized gains and&#13;losses, the range and weighted average of significant unobservable inputs used to develop Level 3 fair value measurements, and the narrative&#13;description of measurement uncertainty should be applied prospectively for only the most recent interim or annual period presented in&#13;the initial fiscal year of adoption. All other amendments should be applied retrospectively to all periods presented upon their effective&#13;date. The amendments are effective for all entities for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, and interim periods within those&#13;fiscal years, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the potential impacts of ASU 2018-13 on its consolidated&#13;financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, &amp;#8220;Leases&#13;(Topic 842).&amp;#8221; The guidance supersedes existing guidance on accounting for leases with the main difference being that operating&#13;leases are to be recorded in the statement of financial position as right-of-use assets and lease liabilities, initially measured at&#13;the present value of the lease payments. For operating leases with a term of 12 months or less, a lessee is permitted to make an accounting&#13;policy election not to recognize lease assets and liabilities. For public business entities, the guidance is effective for fiscal years&#13;beginning after December 15, 2018, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Early application of the guidance is permitted.&#13;In transition, entities are required to recognize and measure leases at the beginning of the earliest period presented using a modified&#13;retrospective approach. The Company adopted ASU 2016-02 on July 1, 2019 and recognize operating lease liabilities with corresponding&#13;right of use (&amp;#8220;ROU&amp;#8221;) assets of the same amount based on the present value of the remaining minimum rental payments under&#13;current leasing standards for existing operating leases with a term longer than 12 months.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company does not believe other recently issued&#13;but not yet effective accounting standards, if currently adopted, would have a material impact on its the consolidated financial position,&#13;statements of operations and cash flows.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2 &amp;#8211; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis of Presentation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying audited consolidated financial statements&#13;have been prepared in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (&amp;#8220;U.S. GAAP&amp;#8221;).&#13;This basis of accounting differs in certain material respects from that used for the preparation of the books of Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai&#13;Cangbao, which are prepared in accordance with the accounting principles and the relevant financial regulations applicable to enterprises&#13;with limited liabilities established in the PRC (&amp;#8220;PRC GAAP&amp;#8221;), the accounting standards used in the places of their domicile.&#13;The accompanying audited consolidated financial statements reflect necessary adjustments not recorded in the books of Hainan Cangbao and&#13;Shanghai Cangbao to present them in conformity with U.S. GAAP.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Principals of Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The audited consolidated financial statements include&#13;the accounts of the Company, its wholly and majority owned subsidiaries, and consolidated VIE and its subsidiaries for which the Company&#13;is the primary beneficiary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;All transactions and balances among the Company, its&#13;subsidiaries and&amp;#160;consolidated VIE have been eliminated upon consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying audited consolidated financial statements&#13;of Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center, Inc. reflect the activities of the following entities:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 153px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; (&amp;#8220;Hainan Cangbao&amp;#8221;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A PRC limited liability company&lt;/p&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Incorporated on May 30, 2018&lt;/p&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Subscribed capital of $1,454,491&#13;    (RMB 10,000,000)&lt;/p&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Operate online and offline cultural&#13;    exchange service platform&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;VIE of Shanghai Cangyun WFOE&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. (&amp;#8220;Shanghai Cangbao&amp;#8221;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A PRC limited liability company&lt;/p&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Incorporated on May 30, 2018&lt;/p&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Subscribed capital of $4,799,821&#13;    (RMB 33,000,000)&lt;/p&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#183;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Operate online and offline cultural&#13;    exchange service platform&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;VIE of Shanghai Cangyun WFO&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;VIE Agreements with Shanghai Cangyun&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Under the laws and regulations of the PRC, foreign&#13;persons and foreign companies are restricted from investing directly in certain businesses within the PRC. As such, Hainan Cangbao and&#13;Shanghai Cangbao are controlled through VIE Arrangements in lieu of direct equity ownership. Such VIE arrangements consist of a series&#13;of four agreements&amp;#160;(collectively,&amp;#160;the &amp;#8220;VIE Arrangements&amp;#8221;), which were signed on August 8, 2019. The significant&#13;terms of the VIE Arrangements&amp;#160;are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Exclusive Management Consultation Service Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Pursuant to the Exclusive Management Consultation&#13;Service Agreement between Management Consulting and Hainan Cangbao Tianxia Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. and Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural&#13;Relic Co. (the &amp;#8220;Target Companies&amp;#8221; or &amp;#8220;VIEs&amp;#8221;), dated August 8, 2019, Management Consulting has the exclusive right&#13;to provide consultation and services to the Target Companies in the areas of funding, human resources, technology and intellectual property&#13;rights. For such services, the Target Companies have agreed to pay service fees in the amount of 100% of their net income and also have&#13;the obligation to absorb 100% of their own losses. Management Consulting exclusively owns any intellectual property rights arising from&#13;the performance of this Management Consultation Service Agreement. The Management Consultation Service Agreement terminates at the same&#13;time as the Equity Pledge Agreement, described in the next paragraph.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Equity Pledge Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Pursuant to those Equity Pledge Agreement dated August&#13;8, 2019, among Management Consulting, the Target Companies, the Target Companies&amp;#8217; shareholders, who are our CEO Mr. Zhou, Yaqin&#13;Fu (the wife of Liang Tan, a director of the Company), and Wei Wang (collectively, the &amp;#8220;Pledgors&amp;#8221;), each of three persons&#13;pledged all of their equity interests in the Target Companies to Management Consulting to guarantee the Target Companies&amp;#8217; performance&#13;of relevant obligations and indebtedness under the Management Consultation Service Agreement and the other control agreements (collectively,&#13;the &amp;#8220;Control Agreements&amp;#8221;). If the Pledgors breach their obligations under the Control Agreements, Management Consulting, as&#13;pledgee, will be entitled to certain rights, including the right to dispose of the pledged equity interests in order to recover the damages&#13;associated with such breaches. The Pledgors&amp;#8217; obligations shall be continuously valid until all of the Pledgors are no longer shareholders&#13;of the Target Companies, or until the satisfaction of all of the Pledgors&amp;#8217; obligations under the Control Agreements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Call Option Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Pursuant to the Call Option Agreement among Management&#13;Consulting, the Target Companies and the Pledgors, dated August 8, 2019, Management Consulting has the exclusive right to require that&#13;the Pledgors fulfill and complete all approval and registration procedures required under PRC laws for Management Consulting to purchase,&#13;or designate one or more persons to purchase, such shareholders&amp;#8217; equity interests in the Target Companies , in one or multiple transactions,&#13;at any time or from time to time, at Management Consulting&amp;#8217;s sole and absolute discretion. The purchase price shall be the lowest&#13;price allowed by PRC laws. The Equity Option Agreements shall remain effective until all the equity interests in the Target Companies&#13;owned by the Pledgors have been legally transferred to Management Consulting or its designee(s).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Proxy Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Pursuant to the Proxy Agreement among Management Consulting,&#13;the Pledgors and the Target Companies, dated August 8, 2019, the Pledgors irrevocably appointed Management Consulting or Management Consulting&amp;#8217;s&#13;designee to exercise all of their rights as a shareholder of the Target Companies, including but not limited to the power to exercise&#13;all such shareholder&amp;#8217;s voting rights with respect to all matters to be discussed and voted in shareholder meetings of the Target&#13;Companies. The Proxy Agreement remains effective until all equity interests in the Target Companies owned by the Pledgors have been legally&#13;transferred to Management Consulting or its designee(s).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Based on the foregoing VIE Arrangements,&amp;#160;Shanghai&#13;Cangyun deemed to have effective control over Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao, which enables Shanghai Cangyun to receive all of their&#13;expected residual returns and absorb the expected losses of the VIE, and Shanghai Cangyun is deemed the primary beneficiary of Hainan&#13;Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The reorganization through VIE above are accounted&#13;as a transaction of entities under common control for accounting purposes where the shareholder of Hainan Cangbao and Shanghai Cangbao&#13;are the controlling shareholder of Cang Bao before and after the reorganization. Accordingly, the accompanying consolidated financial&#13;statements have been prepared as if the current corporate structure had been in existence throughout the periods presented.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The carrying amount of the VIE&amp;#8217;s assets and liabilities are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 72%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Operating revenues&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 10%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(1,430,284&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Loss from operations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(8,409,597&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Net loss&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;(8,411,409&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Foreign Currency Translation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying audited consolidated financial statements&#13;are presented in United States dollar (&amp;#8220;$&amp;#8221;), which is the reporting currency of the Company. The functional currency of Cang&#13;Bao, Cayman Company and Hongkong Company is United States dollar. The functional currency of the Company&amp;#8217;s subsidiaries and VIEs&#13;located in the PRC is Renminbi (&amp;#8220;RMB&amp;#8221;). For the entities whose functional currencies are RMB, results of operations and cash&#13;flows are translated at average exchange rates during the period, assets and liabilities are translated at the unified exchange rate at&#13;the end of the period, and equity is translated at historical exchange rates. The resulting translation adjustments are included in determining&#13;other comprehensive income. Transaction gains and losses are reflected in the consolidated statements of income.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2021&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;
