   &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;6.6273&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;7.0198&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Year-end HKD:US$ exchange rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;7.7638&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;7.7504&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Annual average HKD:US$ exchange rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;7.7558&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;7.7937&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The RMB is not freely convertible into foreign currencies&#13;and all foreign exchange transactions must be conducted through authorized financial institutions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in conformity&#13;with U.S. GAAP requires management to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, disclosure&#13;of contingent assets and liabilities on the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during&#13;the reporting period. The Company bases its estimates and judgments on historical experience and on various other assumptions and information&#13;that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances. Estimates and assumptions of future events and their effects cannot be perceived&#13;with certainty and, accordingly, these estimates may change as new events occur, as more experience is acquired, as additional information&#13;is obtained and as our operating environment changes. Significant estimates and assumptions by management include, among others, useful&#13;lives and impairment of long-lived assets, allowance for doubtful accounts, income taxes including the valuation allowance for deferred&#13;tax assets. While the Company believes that the estimates and assumptions used in the preparation of the financial statements are appropriate,&#13;actual results could differ from those estimates. Estimates and assumptions are periodically reviewed, and the effects of revisions are&#13;reflected in the financial statements in the period they are determined to be necessary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cash and cash equivalents include cash on hand and&#13;cash in time deposits, certificates of deposit and all highly liquid instruments with original maturities of three months or less.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Inventories&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;Inventories,&#13;mainly consisting of stock items prepared as gifts for the member customers and multi-functional demonstration machine, are stated at&#13;the lower of cost or net realizable value utilizing the weighted average method. Cost includes all costs of purchase, cost of conversion&#13;and other costs incurred to bring the inventories to their present location and condition. Net realizable value is the estimated selling&#13;price in the ordinary course of business less the estimated costs of completion of the service and the estimated costs necessary to delivering&#13;the service.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;The valuation&#13;of inventory requires the Company to estimate excess and slow-moving inventories. The Company evaluates the recoverability of the inventory&#13;based on expected demand and market conditions of art trading service.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s long-lived assets are reviewed&#13;for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability&#13;of an asset to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of the asset to the future undiscounted cash flows&#13;expected to be generated by the asset. If such asset is considered to be impaired, the impairment to be recognized is measured by the&#13;amount by which the carrying amount of the asset exceeds its fair value. Impairment evaluations involve management&amp;#8217;s estimates on&#13;asset useful lives and future cash flows. Actual useful lives and cash flows could be different from those estimated by management which&#13;could have a material effect on our reporting results and financial position. Fair value is determined through various valuation techniques&#13;including discounted cash flow models, quoted market values and third-party independent appraisals, as considered necessary.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Plant and Equipment&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Plant and equipment consist of computer, office furniture&#13;and equipment, and leasehold improvement. All plant and equipment are stated at historical cost net of accumulated depreciation. Repairs&#13;and maintenance are expensed as incurred. Plant and equipment are depreciated on a straight-line basis over the following periods:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the estimated&#13;useful lives of the assets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 51%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Electronic equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 46%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;3-5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Furniture and Fixture&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Motor vehicles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;4 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Computer software&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Leasehold improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;5 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company adopted ASC 820 &amp;#8220;Fair Value Measurements,&amp;#8221;&#13;which defines fair value, establishes a three-level valuation hierarchy for disclosures of fair value measurement and enhances disclosures&#13;requirements for fair value measures. Current assets and current liabilities qualified as financial instruments and management believes&#13;their carrying amounts are a reasonable estimate of fair value because of the short period of time between the origination of such instruments&#13;and their expected realization and if applicable, their current interest rate is equivalent to interest rates currently available.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The three levels are defined as follow:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 5%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 93%; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;inputs to the valuation methodology are quoted prices (unadjusted) for identical assets or liabilities in active markets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;inputs to the valuation methodology include quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets, and inputs that are observable for the assets or liability, either directly or indirectly, for substantially the full term of the financial instruments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Level 3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#8212;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;inputs to the valuation methodology are unobservable and significant to the fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of the balance sheet date, the estimated fair values&#13;of the financial instruments approximated their fair values due to the short-term nature of these instruments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company evaluates the hierarchy disclosures each&#13;year to determine which category an asset or liability falls within the hierarchy.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Leases&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;We determine if an arrangement is a lease at inception.&#13;Operating leases are included in operating lease right-of-use (&amp;#8220;ROU&amp;#8221;) assets, operating lease liabilities - current, and operating&#13;lease liabilities - noncurrent on the balance sheets. Finance leases are included in property and equipment, other current liabilities,&#13;and other long-term liabilities in our balance sheets.&amp;#160;&lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;The initial lease liability is equal&#13;to the future fixed minimum lease payments discounted using the Company&amp;#8217;s incremental borrowing rate, on a secured basis. The initial&#13;measurement of the right-of-use asset is equal to the initial lease liability plus any initial direct costs and prepayments, less any&#13;lease incentives.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;ROU assets represent our right to use an underlying&#13;asset for the lease term and lease liabilities represent our obligation to make lease payments arising from the lease. Operating lease&#13;ROU assets and liabilities are recognized at commencement date based on the present value of lease payments over the lease term. As most&#13;of our leases do not provide an implicit rate, we generally use our incremental borrowing rate based on the estimated rate of interest&#13;for collateralized borrowing over a similar term of the lease payments at commencement date. The operating lease ROU asset also includes&#13;any lease payments made and excludes lease incentives. Our lease terms may include options to extend or terminate the lease when it is&#13;reasonably certain that we will exercise that option. Lease expense for lease payments is recognized on a straight-line basis over the&#13;lease term.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company adopted ASC 606 requires the use of a&#13;new five-step model to recognize revenue from customer contracts. The five-step model requires entities to exercise judgment when considering&#13;the terms of contracts, which includes (1) identifying the contracts or agreements with a customer, (2) identifying our performance obligations&#13;in the contract or agreement, (3) determining the transaction price, (4) allocating the transaction price to the separate performance&#13;obligations, and (5) recognizing revenue as each performance obligation is satisfied. The Company has concluded that the new guidance&#13;did not require any significant change to its revenue recognition processes.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company operates an online and offline cultural&#13;service platform, through which dedicated to create industry standards for art investment and creating a model of online art exchanges&#13;and transactions, which allows collectors, artists, art dealers and owners to access a much larger art trading market, allowing them to&#13;engage with a wide range of collectibles or artwork investors.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The service includes trading facilitation, appraisal&#13;of treasures, consignment of artworks, storage of artworks and all-in-one advertising service, etc.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company derives its revenues from (1) platform&#13;membership service fee for member customers and (2) trading commission income, and (3) sales of all-in-one demonstration machine.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Membership service income&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company recognizes membership fee revenue as the&#13;performance obligations are satisfied over time, usually, recognized on an average over the life of membership. The general contract terms&#13;of membership service include timeframe of the service, pricing and payment terms, rights and obligations of parties, performance test&#13;criteria, and liability for breach of contract.&amp;#160;Payments received in advance from customers are recorded as &amp;#8220;advance from customers&amp;#8221;&#13;in the audited consolidated balance sheets. Advance from customers is recognized as revenue over the passage of time. Such advance payment&#13;received are non-refundable.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The cost of revenue consists primarily of platform&#13;maintenance expenses which are directly attributable to the membership fee revenue, including but not limited to service charges for cloud&#13;computing,&amp;#160;&lt;font style="background-color: white"&gt;items prepared as gifts for the member,&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;and related expenses.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Artwork Trading Service commission income&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Artwork trading service commission income includes&#13;commission from artwork price guarantee service, and artwork ownership transfer facilitate service through the online platform. The Company&#13;charges both the buyer and the seller a commission based on the artwork trading amount. The revenue is derived from contracts with customers,&#13;which primarily include payment terms, rights and obligations of parties, acceptance criteria, and liability for breach of contract.&#13;The Company&amp;#8217;s sales arrangements do not contain variable consideration. The Company recognizes revenue at a point in time based&#13;on management&amp;#8217;s evaluation of when performance obligations under the terms of a contract with the customer are satisfied and the&#13;related artworks transactions has been successfully completed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Sales of multi-functional demonstration machine and tablets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company recognizes revenue when the transaction&#13;price is allocated to the performance obligations identified in the contracts or agreements with customer upon the delivery of multi-functional&#13;demonstration machine has completed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company did not recognize any trading commission&#13;income for the year ended June 30, 2021 and 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Advertising Expenses&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Advertising costs, mainly including promotion expense&#13;for the APP launching, are expensed as incurred and the total amounts charged to &amp;#8220;selling and marketing expenses&amp;#8221; in the audited&#13;consolidated statements of income and comprehensive loss were $2,845,139 and $499,954 for the year ended June 30, 2021 and 2020, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Shipping and handling&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;All outbound shipping and handling costs are expensed&#13;as incurred.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;New Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In December 2019, the FASB issued ASU 2019-12 - Income&#13;Taxes (Topic 740): Simplifying the Accounting for Income Taxes. This ASU provides an exception to the general methodology for calculating&#13;income taxes in an interim period when a year-to-date loss exceeds the anticipated loss for the year. This update also (1) requires an&#13;entity to recognize a franchise tax (or similar tax) that is partially based on income as an income-based tax and account for any incremental&#13;amount incurred as a non-income-based tax, (2) requires an entity to evaluate when a step-up in the tax basis of goodwill should be considered&#13;part of the business combination in which goodwill was originally recognized for accounting purposes and when it should be considered&#13;a separate transaction, and (3) requires that an entity reflect the effect of an enacted change in tax laws or rates in the annual effective&#13;tax rate computation in the interim period that includes the enactment date. The standard is effective for the Company for fiscal years&#13;beginning after December 15, 2020, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently in the process of evaluating the impact of&#13;the adoption on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In February 2020, the FASB issued ASU 2020-02, &amp;#8220;Financial&#13;Instruments &amp;#8211; Credit Losses (Topic 326) and Leases (topic 842) Amendments to SEC Paragraphs Pursuant to SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin&#13;No. 119 and Update to SEC Section on Effective Date Related to Accounting Standards Update No. 2016-02, Leases (topic 842)&amp;#8221;. This&#13;ASU provides guidance regarding methodologies, documentation, and internal controls related to expected credit losses. This ASU is effective&#13;for interim and annual periods beginning after December 15, 2019, and early adoption is permitted. The Company is evaluating the impact&#13;of this guidance on its consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2018, the FASB issued ASU 2018-13, &amp;#8220;Fair&#13;Value Measurement (Topic 820), &amp;#8211; Disclosure Framework &amp;#8211; Changes to the Disclosure Requirements for Fair Value Measurement,&amp;#8221;&#13;which makes a number of changes meant to add, modify or remove certain disclosure requirements associated with the movement amongst or&#13;hierarchy associated with Level 1, Level 2 and Level 3 fair value measurements. The amendments in this Update modify the disclosure requirements&#13;on fair value measurements based on the concepts in FASB Concepts Statement, Conceptual Framework for Financial Reporting&amp;#8212;Chapter&#13;8: Notes to Financial Statements, including the consideration of costs and benefits. The amendments on changes in unrealized gains and&#13;losses, the range and weighted average of significant unobservable inputs used to develop Level 3 fair value measurements, and the narrative&#13;description of measurement uncertainty should be applied prospectively for only the most recent interim or annual period presented in&#13;the initial fiscal year of adoption. All other amendments should be applied retrospectively to all periods presented upon their effective&#13;date. The amendments are effective for all entities for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, and interim periods within those&#13;fiscal years, with early adoption permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the potential impacts of ASU 2018-13 on its consolidated&#13;financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, &amp;#8220;Leases&#13;(Topic 842).&amp;#8221; The guidance supersedes existing guidance on accounting for leases with the main difference being that operating&#13;leases are to be recorded in the statement of financial position as right-of-use assets and lease liabilities, initially measured at&#13;the present value of the lease payments. For operating leases with a term of 12 months or less, a lessee is permitted to make an accounting&#13;policy election not to recognize lease assets and liabilities. For public business entities, the guidance is effective for fiscal years&#13;beginning after December 15, 2018, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Early application of the guidance is permitted.&#13;In transition, entities are required to recognize and measure leases at the beginning of the earliest period presented using a modified&#13;retrospective approach. The Company adopted ASU 2016-02 on July 1, 2019 and recognize operating lease liabilities with corresponding&#13;right of use (&amp;#8220;ROU&amp;#8221;) assets of the same amount based on the present value of the remaining minimum rental payments under&#13;current leasing standards for existing operating leases with a term longer than 12 months.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company does not believe other recently issued&#13;but not yet effective accounting standards, if currently adopted, would have a material impact on its the consolidated financial position,&#13;statements of operations and cash flows.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>

margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Amortization expense amounted to $95,739 and $47,576&#13;for the year ended June 30, 2021 and 2020, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; Such advances are partially refundable prior to delivery of goods and defective goods can be exchanged for replacement.&amp;#160;Such&#13;advances may be recognized as revenues when the goods are delivered to and accepted by customers.&lt;/p&gt;</TXCB:AdvanceFromCustomersTextBlock>
    <TXCB:RevenueAndCostOfRevenueTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 10 &amp;#8211; REVENUE AND COST OF REVENUE&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;     <us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeasesTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 11 &amp;#8211; LEASE&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company has operating leases for multimedia tablets&#13;which the Company sublease to customers. These leases have remaining lease terms of 1 year to 3 years. The Company has elected to not&#13;recognize lease assets and liabilities for leases with a term less than twelve months.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Operating lease right-of-use assets and liabilities&#13;are recognized at commencement date based on the present value of lease payments over the lease term. The discount rate used to calculate&#13;present value is incremental borrowing rate or, if available, the rate implicit in the lease. The Company determines the incremental borrowing&#13;rate for each lease based primarily on its lease term in PRC which is approximately 4.75%.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Operating lease expenses were $1,499,902 and $Nil&#13;for the year ended June 30, 2021 and 2020, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The future minimum lease payment schedule as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;     <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 12 &amp;#8211; RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; width: 47%; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Name of related party&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: top;  &lt;tr style="background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Mr. Xingtao Zhou&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Majority shareholder of the Company&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Guangdong Cangbaotianxia Art Co., Ltd&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;A Company with significant influence&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Xi 'an Cangbaotianxia Art Co., Ltd&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;A Company with significant influence&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Related party sale and Account receivable - related parties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2021, the Company made&#13;sales of $92,878 to Guangdong Cangbaotianxia Art Co., Ltd. As of June 30, 2021 and 2020, the outstanding balance of accounts receivable&#13;- related parties was $92,878 and $0, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2021, the Company made sales of $21,486&#13;to Xi 'an Cangbaotianxia Art Co., Ltd. As of June 30, 2021 and 2020, the outstanding balance of accounts receivable - related parties&#13;was $21,486 and $0, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Due to related parties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2021, the Company received&#13;$33,748 in advance from Mr. Xingtao Zhou. As of June 30, 2021 and 2020, the outstanding balance payable to Mr. Xingtao Zhou was $128,793&#13;and $95,045 respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Due from related parties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2021, the Company paid&#13;$1,083,575 to Mr. Xingtao Zhou. As of June 30, 2021 and 2020, the balance receivable from Mr. Xingtao Zhou was $1,083,575 and $28,055&#13;respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The amount is due on demand and non-interest bearing without any formal&#13;agreement.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 13 &amp;#8211; EQUITY&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Preferred Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company is authorized to issue 10,000,000 shares&#13;of $.001 par value preferred shares. On June 19, 2018, the Company created 10,000,000 shares of Series A Preferred Stock, out of the 10,000,000&#13;shares that were already authorized. On that same date, the Company issued 10,000,000 shares of the Series A preferred stock to Custodian&#13;Ventures LLC, the company controlled by David Lazar, Chief Executive Officer for services valued at $4,000,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The following is a description of the material rights of our Series A Preferred&#13;Stock:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Each share of Series A Preferred Stock shall have&#13;a par value of $0.001 per share. The Series A Preferred Stock shall vote on any matter that may from time to time be submitted to the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s shareholders for a vote, on a 1 for one basis. If the Company effects a stock split which either increases or decreases&#13;the number of shares of Common Stock outstanding and entitled to vote, the voting rights of the Series A shall not be subject to adjustment&#13;unless specifically authorized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Each share of Series A Preferred Stock shall be convertible&#13;at a rate of $0.0000025 per share of Common Stock (&amp;#8220;Conversion Ratio&amp;#8221;), at the option of a Holder, at any time and from time&#13;to time, from and after the issuance of the Series A Preferred Stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Subject to the rights of any existing series of Preferred&#13;Stock or to the rights of any series of Preferred Stock which may from time to time hereafter come into existence, the holders of shares&#13;of Series A Preferred Stock shall be entitled to receive dividends, out of any assets legally available therefor, upon any payment of&#13;any dividend (payable other than in Common Stock or other securities and rights convertible into or entitling the holder thereof to receive,&#13;directly or indirectly, additional shares of Common Stock of the Corporation) on the Common Stock of the Corporation, as and if declared&#13;by the Board of Directors, as if the Series A Preferred Stock had been converted into Common Stock. Subject to the rights of any existing&#13;series of Preferred Stock or to the rights of any series of Preferred Stock which may from time to time hereafter come into existence,&#13;the payment of any dividends on the any series or classes of stock of the Corporation shall be subject to any priority set forth in Paragraph&#13;(I)(c)(3) of Article FIFTH of the Articles of Incorporation, as such may from time to time be amended.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In the event of any liquidation, dissolution or winding&#13;up of the Corporation, either voluntary or involuntary, subject to the rights of any existing series of Preferred Stock or to the rights&#13;of any series of Preferred Stock which may from time to time hereafter come into existence, the holders of the Series A Preferred Stock&#13;shall be entitled to receive, prior and in preference to any distribution of any of the assets of the Corporation to the holders of Common&#13;Stock by reason of their ownership thereof, an amount per share equal to the price per share actually paid to the Corporation upon the&#13;initial issuance of the Series A Preferred Stock (each, the &amp;#8220;the Original Issue Price&amp;#8221;) for each share of Series A Preferred&#13;Stock then held by them, plus declared but unpaid dividends. Unless the Corporation can establish a different Original Issue Price in&#13;connection with a particular sale of Series A Preferred Stock, the Original issue price shall be $0.001 per share for the Series A Preferred&#13;Stock. If, upon the occurrence of any liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the Corporation, the assets and funds thus distributed&#13;among the holders of the Series A Preferred Stock shall be insufficient to permit the payment to such holders of the full aforesaid preferential&#13;amounts, then, subject to the rights of any existing series of Preferred Stock or to the rights of any series of Preferred Stock which&#13;may from time to time hereafter come into existence, the entire assets and funds of the corporation legally available for distribution&#13;shall be distributed ratably among the holders of the each series of Preferred Stock in proportion to the preferential amount each such&#13;holder is otherwise entitled to receive.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Series A Preferred Stock shares are nonredeemable&#13;other than upon the mutual agreement of the Company and the holder of shares to be redeemed, and even in such case only to the extent&#13;permitted by this Certificate of Designation, the Corporation&amp;#8217;s Articles of Incorporation and applicable law.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Series A Preferred Stock shall be convertible, at&#13;the option of the holder thereof, at any time after the date of issuance of such share, at the office of the Corporation or any transfer&#13;agent for such stock, into such number of fully paid and nonassessable shares of Common Stock as is determined by dividing the Original&#13;Issue Price of the Series A Preferred Stock by the Series A Conversion Price applicable to such share, determined as hereafter provided,&#13;in effect on the date the certificate is surrendered for conversion. The initial Series A Conversion Price per share shall be $0.0000025&#13;for shares of Series A Preferred Stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Each share of Series A Preferred Stock shall automatically&#13;be converted into shares of Common Stock at the applicable Series A Conversion Price in effect for such share immediately upon the earlier&#13;of (i) except as provided below in Section 4(c), the Corporation&amp;#8217;s sale of its Common Stock in a public offering pursuant to a registration&#13;statement under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended; (ii) a liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the Corporation as defined in&#13;section 2(c) above but subject to any liquidation preference required by section 2(a) above; or (iii) the date specified by written consent&#13;or agreement of the holders of a majority of the then outstanding shares of Series A Preferred Stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The holder of each share of Series A Preferred Stock&#13;shall have the right to one vote for each share of Series A Preferred Stock, and with respect to such vote, such holder shall have full&#13;voting rights and powers equal to the voting rights and powers of the holders of Common Stock, and shall be entitled to notice of any&#13;stockholders&amp;#8217; meeting in accordance with the bylaws of the Corporation, and shall be entitled to vote, together with holders of&#13;Common Stock, with respect to any question upon which holders of Common Stock have the right to vote. Fractional votes shall not, however,&#13;be permitted and any fractional voting rights shall be rounded to the nearest whole number (with one-half being rounded upward).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 14, 2019, the Company issued 32,000,000&#13;common shares to shareholders pursuant to the conversion of 80,000 shares of Series A Preferred Stock at a conversion price of $0.0000025&#13;per common share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2021, 9,920,000 preferred shares remain&#13;outstanding, which are owned by Xingtao Zhou, CEO.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Common Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On June 19, 2018, the Company issued 3,096,200 shares&#13;of common stock issued at par value of $0.001, for services valued at $3,096 to Custodian Ventures, LLC, the company controlled by David&#13;Lazar.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 14, 2019, the Company issued 32,000,000&#13;common shares to shareholders pursuant to the conversion of 80,000 shares of Series A Preferred Stock at a conversion price of $0.0000025&#13;per common share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 27, 2020 (the &amp;#8220;Closing Date&amp;#8221;),&#13;Cang Bao entered into a Share Exchange Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Exchange Agreement&amp;#8221;) by and among (i) Cang Bao, (ii) Zhi Yuan Limited,&#13;a Cayman Islands company (&amp;#8220;Cayman Company&amp;#8221;), and (iii) the three beneficial shareholders of Cayman Company (each, a &amp;#8220;Cayman&#13;Company Shareholder&amp;#8221; and collectively, the &amp;#8220;Cayman Company Shareholders&amp;#8221;)&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Pursuant to the terms of the Exchange Agreement, the&#13;Cayman Company Shareholders agreed to sell to Cang Bao, and Cang Bao agreed to purchase, all shares of Cayman Company held by them, which&#13;shares represent 100% of the issued and outstanding shares of Cayman Company. In exchange, Cang Bao agreed to issue to the Cayman Company&#13;Shareholders an aggregate of 75,000,000 shares of common stock, representing approximately 67.98% of Cang Bao&amp;#8217;s total issued and&#13;outstanding common stock (the &amp;#8220;Share Exchange&amp;#8221;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2021, 110,319,245 common shares are&#13;issued and outstanding with a par value of 0.001.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Restricted net assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s ability to pay dividends is primarily&#13;dependent on the Company receiving distributions of funds from its subsidiary or VIE. Relevant PRC statutory laws and regulations permit&#13;payments of dividends by Shanghai Cangyun, Hainan Cangbao, and Shanghai Cangbao only out of its retained earnings, if any, as determined&#13;in accordance with PRC accounting standards and regulations and after it has met the PRC requirements for appropriation to statutory reserves.&#13;Paid in capital of the PRC subsidiary and VIE and VIE&amp;#8217;s subsidiaries included in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated net assets are&#13;also non-distributable for dividend purposes. The results of operations reflected in the accompanying consolidated financial statements&#13;prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP differ from those reflected in the statutory financial statements of Shanghai Cangyun, Hainan Cangbao,&#13;and Shanghai Cangbao. The Company is required to set aside at least 10% of their after-tax profits each year, if any, to fund certain&#13;statutory reserve funds until such reserve funds reach 50% of its registered capital. In addition, the Company may allocate a portion&#13;of its after-tax profits based on PRC accounting standards to enterprise expansion fund and staff bonus and welfare fund at its discretion.&#13;The statutory reserve funds and the discretionary funds are not distributable as cash dividends.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The ability of the Company&amp;#8217;s PRC subsidiary&#13;and VIE and VIE&amp;#8217;s subsidiaries to make dividends and other payments to the Company may also be restricted by changes in applicable&#13;foreign exchange and other laws and regulations. Foreign currency exchange regulation in China is primarily governed by the following&#13;rules:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 32px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Foreign Exchange Administration Rules (1996), as amended in August 2008, or the Exchange Rules;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 32px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&amp;#9679;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Administration Rules of the Settlement, Sale and Payment of Foreign Exchange (1996), or the Administration Rules.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Currently, under the Administration Rules, Renminbi&#13;is freely convertible for current account items, including the distribution of dividends, interest payments, trade and service related&#13;foreign exchange transactions, but not for capital account items, such as direct investments, loans, repatriation of investments and investments&#13;in securities outside of China, unless the prior approval of the State Administration of Foreign Exchange (the &amp;#8220;SAFE&amp;#8221;) is&#13;obtained and prior registration with the SAFE is made. Foreign-invested enterprises like Rise King WFOE that need foreign exchange for&#13;the distribution of profits to its shareholders may affect payment from their foreign exchange accounts or purchase and pay foreign exchange&#13;rates at the designated foreign exchange banks to their foreign shareholders by producing board resolutions for such profit distribution.&#13;Based on their needs, foreign-invested enterprises are permitted to open foreign exchange settlement accounts for current account receipts&#13;and payments of foreign exchange along with specialized accounts for capital account receipts and payments of foreign exchange at certain&#13;designated foreign exchange banks.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Although the current Exchange Rules allow the convertibility&#13;of Chinese Renminbi into foreign currency for current account items, conversion of Chinese Renminbi into foreign exchange for capital&#13;items, such as foreign direct investment, loans or securities, requires the approval of SAFE, which is under the authority of the People&amp;#8217;s&#13;Bank of China. These approvals, however, do not guarantee the availability of foreign currency conversion. The Company cannot be sure&#13;that it will be able to obtain all required conversion approvals for its operations or the Chinese regulatory authorities will not impose&#13;greater restrictions on the convertibility of Chinese Renminbi in the future. Currently, most of the Company&amp;#8217;s retained earnings&#13;are generated in Renminbi. Any future restrictions on currency exchanges may limit the Company&amp;#8217;s ability to use its retained earnings&#13;generated in Renminbi to make dividends or other payments in U.S. dollars or fund possible business activities outside China.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#8217;s VIE and its subsidiaries in Renminbi&#13;included in the Company&amp;#8217; consolidated net assets, aside from statutory reserve funds, that may be affected by increased restrictions&#13;on currency exchanges in the future and accordingly may further limit the Company&amp;#8217;s PRC subsidiary and VIE and VIE&amp;#8217;s subsidiaries&amp;#8217;&#13;ability to make dividends or other payments in U.S. dollars to the Company, in addition to restricted net assets as discussed above.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 14 &amp;#8211; INCOME TAXES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;United States of America&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cang Bao Tian Xia International Art Trade Center Inc&#13;is incorporated in the State of Nevada and is subject to Nevada and US Federal tax laws. Cang Bao has not recognized an income tax benefit&#13;for its operating losses based on uncertainties concerning its ability to generate taxable in future period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The components of deferred tax assets and liabilities as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cayman Islands&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Under the current laws of Cayman Islands, Zhi Yuan&#13;Limited is not subject to tax on income or capital gain. In addition, payments of dividends by the Company to their shareholders are not&#13;subject to withholding tax in the Cayman Islands.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Hong Kong&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Cang Yun (Hong Kong) Limited was incorporated under&#13;the Hong Kong tax laws, and the statutory income tax rate was 16.5%. Cang Yun (Hong Kong) Limited has no operating profit or tax liabilities&#13;as of June 30, 2021 and 2020.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;China, PRC&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Shanghai Cangyun Management Consulting Co.,Ltd., Hainan&#13;Cangbao Tianxia Cultural Relic Co., Ltd. and Cangbao Tianxia (Shanghai) Cultural Relic Co.,Ltd. were incorporated in the PRC and are subject&#13;to PRC Enterprise Income Tax (&amp;#8220;EIT&amp;#8221;) on the taxable income in accordance with the relevant PRC income tax laws. On March 16,&#13;2007, the National People&amp;#8217;s Congress enacted a new enterprise income tax law, which took effect on January 1, 2008. The law applies&#13;a uniform 25% enterprise income tax rate to both foreign invested enterprises and domestic enterprises.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company has not recognized an income tax benefit&#13;for its operating losses based on uncertainties concerning its ability to generate taxable income in future periods.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The components of deferred tax assets and liabilities as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2020&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13; background-color: #CCFFCC"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Deferred tax asset, net&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The tax authority of the PRC government conducts periodic&#13;and ad hoc tax filing reviews on business enterprises operating in the PRC after those enterprises complete their relevant tax filings.&#13;Therefore, the Company&amp;#8217;s PRC entities&amp;#8217; tax filings results are subject to change. It is therefore uncertain as to whether&#13;the PRC tax authority may take different views about the Company&amp;#8217;s PRC entities&amp;#8217; tax filings, which may lead to additional&#13;tax liabilities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;ASC 740 requires recognition and measurement of uncertain&#13;income tax positions using a &amp;#8220;more-likely-than-not&amp;#8221; approach. The management evaluated the Company&amp;#8217;s tax positions and&#13;concluded that no provision for uncertainty in income taxes was necessary as of June 30, 2021 and 2020.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>

   &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;As of June 30,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;184,703&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;11,681&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="padding-bottom: 2.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;/table&gt;</us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ScheduleOfInventoryCurrentTableTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Inventory consisted of the following:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;     <us-gaap:ScheduleOfAccountsNotesLoansAndFinancingReceivableTextBlock contextRef="From2020-07-01to2021-06-30">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;June 30,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;June 30,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2021&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3" style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2020&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="3"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 6%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 6%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 11%; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;3,364,041&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;  &lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Less: allowance for doubtful accounts&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;
